User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the PhishNix platform.

UrlAnalysis.title: UrlAnalysis
UrlAnalysis.description: Represents the analysis of a URL.

id.description: Unique identifier for the URL analysis.

isSafe.description: Indicates whether the URL is considered safe.

trustScore.description: A score representing the trust level of the URL.

analysisDate.description: The date and time when the URL was analyzed.

PaymentAnalysis.title: PaymentAnalysis
PaymentAnalysis.description: Represents the analysis of a payment link.

id.description: Unique identifier for the payment analysis.

paymentLink.description: The payment link that was analyzed.

isSafe.description: Indicates whether the payment link is considered safe.

trustScore.description: A score representing the trust level of the payment link.

analysisDate.description: The date and time when the payment link was analyzed.

QrCodeAnalysis.title: QrCodeAnalysis
QrCodeAnalysis.description: Represents the analysis of a QR code.

id.description: Unique identifier for the QR code analysis.

qrCodeContent.description: The content extracted from the QR code (e.g., URL).

isSafe.description: Indicates whether the QR code content is considered safe.

trustScore.description: A score representing the trust level of the QR code content.

analysisDate.description: The date and time when the QR code was analyzed.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and scalability. User data is stored in a private collection (`/users/{userId}`) to enforce path-based ownership.  Analysis entities (UrlAnalysis, PaymentAnalysis, QrCodeAnalysis) are stored as subcollections under the respective user's document. This structure provides a clear hierarchical ownership model. There is no need to denormalize any authorization data due to the chosen structure.

This design inherently supports QAPs.  `list` operations on `/users/{userId}/urlAnalysis` will only return documents associated with the specified `userId`, as defined by the path.
